thread.title: Waddle: Forte, Bears likely to part ways after season
thread.title_full: Waddle: Forte, Bears likely to part ways after season | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Waddle: Forte, Bears likely to part ways after season
text:
Bears running back Matt Forte has been the most integral part of the team’s offense since he broke unto the NFL scene in 2008.
Despite being the second leading rusher in Bears history (8,071), behind the great Walter Payton, the team’s woeful start to the 2015 season has many questioning how long Forte will remain with the team.
Tom Waddle of the “Waddle and Silvy Show” went on ESPN’s “Mike and Mike” to defend why he thinks the team will part ways with its most viable offensive weapon.
Waddle doesn't envision Bears future with Matt Forte http://t.co/00pQvs7TTh -via ESPN http://t.co/xmZCnMm1iu #IHearTeddyP
— Bigg Papa The Don (@biggpapi13) October 5, 2015
“You don’t want to appropriate 6-8 million to a running back whose 30-years of age when you have so many other needs,” he said. “My guess would actually be that the Matt Forte-Chicago Bears relationship will end at the end of this season and the Bears should throw him a parade.”
This season , Forte has maintained a 4.4 yards per rush average on 367 running yards, and 133 yards receiving through four games. As usual, he’s near the top of the league for yards from scrimmage.
Maybe the Bears victory over Oakland Sunday bought Forte more time in the Windy City?
